intro: Grisebachianthus holguinensis, commonly known as the Holguin's grisebachia, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
